H1.text: who is considered the father of modern behaviorism. Edward Thorndike

H2.text: who is considered the father of modern behaviorism. Clark Hull

H3.text: who is considered the father of modern behaviorism. John B. Watson

A4.text: In 1913, Watson published the article 'Psychology as the Behaviorist Views It' (also called 'The Behaviorist Manifesto')

A5.text: It was Watson's new behaviorism that would pave the way for further advancements in psychology
